Posts.Content: paulatkc wrote: Any of you sisters out there have any experience with Afinitor? I was dx yesterday with recurrence in my lungs and lymph nodes...onco wants to start this therapy to hold things at bay and start chemo later...I have surgery tomorrow to remove a tumor I found near my collar bone...please let me know... DX 01/2010 IDC Stage 3B Grade 3 13/20 nodes, 4xFEC, 4xTaxol, 35 Rads, Femara, Aromasin Dx 2/11/2010, IDC, Right, 5cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 13/20 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Surgery 8/2/2014 Lymph node removal: Right Surgery 8/10/2014 Lymph node removal: Right Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2015 11:58PM paulatkc wrote: That is horrible! What are you doing to build up your immune system? Are you into alternative therapies at all? Thanks for replying!
Posts.Title: Itchy rash/hives from Taxotere??? mdg doxie

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2015 07:24PM paulatkc wrote: I had a recurrence of Triple Negative BC that began in July--lymph nodes and lungs were too full of tumors to count. I have had six rounds of taxotere, and have had fantastic results as far as shrinking and eradicating tumors are concerned. My onco told me that I was chronic, that I would have to have chemo forever. I went to this thread because bless your hearts, you are dealing with Taxotere and hives and horrible rashes. This all started for me too last night. I was taking an epsom salt bath, and broke out in hives in an armband shape around my right upper arm, no lymph system there to help wash out any poisons, so I think it came out there on my skin. So once you developed rashes and hives did your Onco continue giving you Taxotere or did they switch it up? Maybe my hives made up my mind for me, no more taxotere for this woman, in spite of the amazing results. Love to all...

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2015 12:51AM - edited Mar 30, 2015 01:01AM by paulatkc after 10 rounds of taxotere I had a nodule poke up its head by my collarbone. Now I have done two rounds of carboplatin alongside the taxotere, but the lump isn't responding well...it is harder getting back to normal after treatment, but I have at least one good week before the next round...carboplatin is supposed to be the best for triple_negative....God bless us all....
Posts.Title: Anybody on carboplatin? Mayhem kebab

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2015 05:40AM paulatkc wrote: Thank you bestbird for all of your information and help.I was recently dx with Mets to the pleural space and middle stomach lymph nodes. After being on taxotere a year now, my oncologist added xeloda. I had thoracentesis done July 23... 1 & 1/2 liters on each side, and now tonight I realize I will have to do it again. Not being able to breathe really is scary, and I am worried that the xeloda isn't working...although I have only done one 14 day round. Thank you for helping me to know the options...I wish my oncologist were as forthcoming.
